Author: cipi#4502
Content: i think best is if i remove confpath from github, so that it does not interfere...

Author: Jenova#8529
Content: on Windows App, the path is different so it doesn't recognize it

Author: Jenova#8529
Content: i tried to change the path in BarterDEX\CoinsDB\coins but it's reset at launch

Author: cipi#4502
Content: yes, confpath paramater has problems in Windows... saw this many times... so best is to not use it

Author: Jenova#8529
Content: ok

Author: cipi#4502
Content: it is reset, because it is in github

Author: Jenova#8529
Content:
so if removed from github/code
the app will find the .conf itself or do we have to add it manually?

Author: Jenova#8529
Content: yes i saw that

Author: cipi#4502
Content: BarterDEX uses the paramater `name` to find the config file... in Linux it then looks for `~/.$name/$name.conf`

Author: cipi#4502
Content: confpath was added later because there are coins that don't name the datadir the same as the config file... no idea why

Author: Jenova#8529
Content: ok

Author: Jenova#8529
Content: so remove it from code should solved the problem

Author: cipi#4502
Content: ok, will remove it

Author: Jenova#8529
Content: thanks cipi üëçüèº

Author: Riddlez666#9550
Content: Looking to integrate a ETH clone chain onto the platform, willing to put in the work to make it happen and help test to make it easier for other ETH clones.

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content:
Regarding the @Riddlez666 question, let me link to the prior discussion at https://discordapp.com/channels/412898016371015680/449948353531478037/566707349000159233.

@Riddlez666 , does the clone have a public repository? Any changes in the coin APIs that you know of? Have you tried adding the ETH clone into our `coins` file and how did it go if you did?

Author: Riddlez666#9550
Content: No changes to the API, and yes tried adding it here is PR https://github.com/jl777/coins/pull/277

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content: https://github.com/TeamEGEM

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I presume with a JSON field to indicate it is an ETH clone and another to specify its infuria servers, it wouldnt be too hard to add support

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content: For mm2 the presence of the "etomic" field in the `coins` file switches us into the ETH mode.

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content: https://github.com/artemii235/SuperNET/blob/86285682aade246435f9dfd710e0f371f870a67e/mm2src/coins/lp_coins.rs#L826

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content: And then the "urls" field in the "enable" RPC call is used to get to the ETH APIs.

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content: https://github.com/artemii235/SuperNET/blob/86285682aade246435f9dfd710e0f371f870a67e/mm2src/coins/eth.rs#L1214

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content: So in the `coins` file we only need the "etomic" field added.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but also need to know it is an ETH clone and not ETH

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and how to talk to the clones infuria

Author: Riddlez666#9550
Content: this is our repo for everything we left github a while back, anything on GH is outdated https://git.egem.io/team/

Author: Riddlez666#9550
Content: so just need to know what API requirements also, as we have the EtomicSwap contract deployed also

Author: Riddlez666#9550
Content: but also how to tell that we are not ETH but a clone like litecoin is to bitcoin

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content: kk! @artem.pikulin will later add a definitive answer on these. Meanwhile, @Riddlez666 , I think it'll help if you could give us an example of the Web3 URLs that ought to be used with EGEM.

Author: Riddlez666#9550
Content:
any CURL request like for infuria would/should work like ```curl -X POST \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
--data '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id": 1, "method": "eth_blockNumber", "params": []}' \
"https://lb.rpc.egem.io"```

Author: Riddlez666#9550
Content: thank you for taking the time to respond btw

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content: mm2 connection to that new coin works:

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content:
```
    target/debug/mm2 '{"passphrase": "qwe", "coins": [{"coin": "EGEM", "name": "ethergem", "fname": "EtherGem", "etomic": "0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000", "rpcport": 80, "mm2": 1}]}'

    curl --url "http://127.0.0.1:7783" --data '{"userpass": "3214c0496196b9c20bee726ca0cb982ffd7888187d0d0de9da342135a7dc807c", "method": "enable", "coin": "EGEM", "mm2": 1, "urls": ["https://lb.rpc.egem.io"], "swap_contract_address": "0xa09ad3cd7e96586ebd05a2607ee56b56fb2db8fd"}'

    {"address":"0xb4487a5a36cf924d4770139f8978ebaabbddae4e","balance":0.0,"coin":"EGEM","result":"success"}

    14 14:21:54, lp_coins:842] ticker = "EGEM", etomic, method = "enable", block_count = 2399442
```

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: @Riddlez666 Hi, to swap EGEM with other coins you also have to deploy etomic swap smart contract (https://github.com/artemii235/etomic-swap) to EGEM network, I can see `0xc9360dC1CACCf570B0A73404C7Ba2eca465AC58F` address in your PR (https://github.com/jl777/coins/pull/277/files#diff-cb00e2d742e5694f0c91a60aa30a9431R2), but the source code is not validated on explorer: https://explorer.egem.io/addr/0xc9360dc1caccf570b0a73404c7ba2eca465ac58f. Could you please add contract source to help us be sure that it would work?

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
We have discussed for a long time that #dev-tradebots & #dev-marketmaker are pretty much the same thing. I think we agreed to merge these channels long time ago but it was never done.

I'll move this channel to the "archived" category and we can start using the remaining #dev-marketmaker channel.

If you disagree let me know and we can always undo this change or find an alternative solution.
